languages.text: "Совсем недавно я прочла трактат Паисия де Моббиуса, согласно которому подданные никогда не верят, что новый правитель окажется лучше старого, если только старый правитель не был тираном. Однако при любом раскладе челядь обманывается в своих упованиях на будущее — и стремится устроить мятеж в угоду своим низменным желаниям. Что вы думаете по этому поводу?"

traits.locale_text: "Совсем недавно я прочла трактат Паисия де Моббиуса, согласно которому подданные никогда не верят, что новый правитель окажется лучше старого, если только старый правитель не был тираном. Однако при любом раскладе челядь обманывается в своих упованиях на будущее — и стремится устроить мятеж в угоду своим низменным желаниям. Что вы думаете по этому поводу?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"
languages.original_text: "Совсем недавно я прочла трактат Паисия де Моббиуса, согласно которому подданные никогда не верят, что новый правитель окажется лучше старого, если только старый правитель не был тираном. Однако при любом раскладе челядь обманывается в своих упованиях на будущее — и стремится устроить мятеж в угоду своим низменным желаниям. Что вы думаете по этому поводу?"

traits.locale_text: "Not long ago I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius who claimed the subjects would never believe their new ruler is better than the old one, unless the old one was a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become disappointed in their expectations for the future — and start a mutiny to please their base desires. What do you think about this?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

traits.locale_text: "Not long ago I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius who claimed the subjects would never believe their new ruler is better than the old one, unless the old one was a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become disappointed in their expectations for the future — and start a mutiny to please their base desires. What do you think about this?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

traits.locale_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

traits.locale_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

traits.locale_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: “我最近读了一篇帕西乌斯·德·莫比乌斯撰写的论文。他说，臣民永远都不会相信新的统治者会比旧的统治者更好，除非旧的统治者是个暴君。他还说，无论在什么情况下，卑贱的乌合之众都会对未来产生错觉，还会在基本欲望的驱使下造反。你是怎么看待这个问题的？”
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: “我最近读了一篇帕西乌斯·德·莫比乌斯撰写的论文。他说，臣民永远都不会相信新的统治者会比旧的统治者更好，除非旧的统治者是个暴君。他还说，无论在什么情况下，卑贱的乌合之众都会对未来产生错觉，还会在基本欲望的驱使下造反。你是怎么看待这个问题的？”
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: «Hace poco leí un tratado de Paisius de Mobbius en el que afirmaba que los súbditos nunca creerán que su nuevo gobernante es mejor que el anterior a no ser que este último haya sido un tirano. Independientemente de las circunstancias, la plebe empieza a delirar con respecto a sus posibilidades y se rebela para saciar sus deseos básicos. ¿Qué opina al respecto?».
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: «Hace poco leí un tratado de Paisius de Mobbius en el que afirmaba que los súbditos nunca creerán que su nuevo gobernante es mejor que el anterior a no ser que este último haya sido un tirano. Independientemente de las circunstancias, la plebe empieza a delirar con respecto a sus posibilidades y se rebela para saciar sus deseos básicos. ¿Qué opina al respecto?».
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: 「パイシウス・ド・モビウスの論文を最近読んだのですが、彼は、旧支配者が暴君でない限り、臣民は新支配者が旧支配者より優れているとは決して思わない、と主張していました。どんな状況であろうと、ロウボーンは自分たちの未来を妄信し、自分たちの卑しい欲望を支持して反乱を起こす、というのです。どう思われますか？」
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: 「パイシウス・ド・モビウスの論文を最近読んだのですが、彼は、旧支配者が暴君でない限り、臣民は新支配者が旧支配者より優れているとは決して思わない、と主張していました。どんな状況であろうと、ロウボーンは自分たちの未来を妄信し、自分たちの卑しい欲望を支持して反乱を起こす、というのです。どう思われますか？」
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: "Ich habe kürzlich eine Abhandlung von Paisius de Mobbius gelesen, der behauptet, Untertanen würden ihren neuen Herrscher nur dann für besser als den alten halten, wenn dieser ein Tyrann war. Ungeachtet der Umstände schätzt der niedrige Pöbel seine Aussichten falsch ein und rebelliert für seine Grundbedürfnisse. Was haltet Ihr davon?"
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: "Ich habe kürzlich eine Abhandlung von Paisius de Mobbius gelesen, der behauptet, Untertanen würden ihren neuen Herrscher nur dann für besser als den alten halten, wenn dieser ein Tyrann war. Ungeachtet der Umstände schätzt der niedrige Pöbel seine Aussichten falsch ein und rebelliert für seine Grundbedürfnisse. Was haltet Ihr davon?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: « J'ai récemment lu un traité de Paisius de Mobbius selon lequel les sujets préfèrent toujours leur ancien souverain au nouveau, si tant est que l'ancien ne fût pas un tyran. Il prétend également que, quelles que soient les circonstances, les gens de basse extraction se bercent d'illusions sur leurs perspectives d'avenir et se rebellent uniquement pour satisfaire à leurs besoins les plus primaires. Qu'en pensez-vous ? »
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: « J'ai récemment lu un traité de Paisius de Mobbius selon lequel les sujets préfèrent toujours leur ancien souverain au nouveau, si tant est que l'ancien ne fût pas un tyran. Il prétend également que, quelles que soient les circonstances, les gens de basse extraction se bercent d'illusions sur leurs perspectives d'avenir et se rebellent uniquement pour satisfaire à leurs besoins les plus primaires. Qu'en pensez-vous ? »
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion

languages.text: "Yakın zamanda Paisius de Mobbius'un yazdığı bilimsel bir tezi okudum. Tezde, eski yönetici eğer bir despot değilse yönetilenlerin yeni yöneticinin eskisinden daha iyi olduğuna asla inanmayacağını iddia ediyordu. Nasıl bir durum içinde olurlarsa olsunlar, soylu olmayan ayaktakımı umut duygusuna körlemesine bağlanır ve temel arzuları doğrultusunda ayaklanırmış. Sen bu konuda ne düşünüyorsun?"
languages.original_text: "I read a treatise by Paisius de Mobbius very recently, who claimed that subjects would never believe their new ruler was better than the old one unless the old one had been a tyrant. No matter the circumstances, the lowborn rabble become deluded about their prospects and rebel in favour of their base desires. What do you make of that?"

traits.locale_text: "Yakın zamanda Paisius de Mobbius'un yazdığı bilimsel bir tezi okudum ve bu tezde, eski yönetici eğer bir despot değilse, yönetilenlerin yeni yöneticinin eskisinden daha iyi olduğuna asla inanmayacağını iddia ediyordu. Nasıl bir durum içinde olurlarsa olsunlar, soylu olmayan ayaktakımı umut duygusuna körlemesine bağlanır ve temel arzuları doğrultusunda ayaklanır. Sen bu konuda ne düşünüyorsun?"
traits.speaker: CassiaCompanion
